Package net.minestom.server.instance.palette

Class PaletteStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.instance.palette.PaletteStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, PublicCloneable<PaletteStorage>
    public class PaletteStorage
extends java.lang.Object
implements PublicCloneable<PaletteStorage>
    Used to efficiently store blocks with an optional palette.

    The format used is the one described in the ChunkDataPacket, the reason is that it allows us to write the packet much faster.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaletteStorage

        public PaletteStorage​(int bitsPerEntry,
                      int bitsIncrement)
        Creates a new palette storage.
        Parameters:
        bitsPerEntry - the number of bits used for one entry (block)
        bitsIncrement - the number of bits to add per-block once the palette array is filled

      • getSectionBlocks

        public long[][] getSectionBlocks()
        Gets the sections of this object, the first array representing the chunk section and the second the block position from getSectionIndex(int, int, int).
        Returns:
        the section blocks

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Loops through all the sections and blocks to find unused array (empty chunk section)

        Useful after clearing one or multiple sections of a chunk. Can be unnecessarily expensive if the chunk is composed of almost-empty sections since the loop will not stop until a non-air block is discovered.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all the data in the palette and data array.
